DOC.detailed_description: Main objective : To evaluate effectiveness smoke cessation advice combine detailed discussion spirometric result primary care practitioner smoke habit adult smoker . Methodology : Design : Intervention study use randomise control group . Setting : 12 primary care centre two health area . Participants : 600 smoker , age 35 70 year , seek medical advice primary care practitioner ( GP ) give reason ( selection visit ) , exclude patient Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease ( COPD ) . Measurements intervention : In selection visit , participant require undergo series test include spirometry , tobacco dependence test , test measure motivation stop smoking structure questionnaire sociodemographic data , smoke habit , respiratory symptomatology , etc . Based spirometric result , patient present airflow limitation exclude . Randomisation perform use computer programme . Randomisation carry Coordinating Centre . All patient schedule another visit primary care practitioner one month later . In visit ( visit 1 ) depend randomisation 2 group , one group give brief structure smoking cessation advice together detail structured discussion spirometric result second group also give brief smoke cessation advice without discuss spirometric result . Both group schedule visit 6 month ( visit 2 ) , 1 year ( visit 3 ) . During visit 2 , patient ask smoking habit . One month visit 3 , patient require undergo series test perform prior visit 1 . In visit 3 , patient claim stop smoke required take carbon monoxide test .
